thread.title: Tesla Model S P100D Breaks Quarter-Mile Record In 10.638 Seconds
thread.title_full: Tesla Model S P100D Breaks Quarter-Mile Record In 10.638 Seconds

author: Ryan Felton
title: Tesla Model S P100D Breaks Quarter-Mile Record In 10.638 Seconds
text:
Go to permalink GIF 
Tesla’s new Ludicrous+ mode is being attributed to a goddamn crazy fast quarter-mile run of 10.726 seconds, a new world record that lasted briefly, before another Model S P100D managed to shatter that time as well. Dad Of The Year Owns His Kids With Tesla Model S's Ludicrous Mode Dad Of The Year Owns His Kids With Tesla Model S's Ludicrous Mode Dad Of The Year Owns His Kids With Tesla Model… If you love your car, there’s a good chance you get really particular about food and drink inside… Read more Read more 
According to Electrek , DragTimes filmed two races with two different Model S P100Ds running against a Camaro ZL1 and a BMW 550i, and Tesla’s electric car managed to break the four-door production car record in the quarter-mile with a 10.723 second run. 
And then, as Electrek pointed out, the record was broken again on the same day by a stock 2017 Tesla Model S P100D. It did the deed in 10.638s at 124.65 mph. The vehicle, according to DragTimes , had “no changes to anything, original interior, original wheels, [and] original tires”: 
Just a shade over 10 seconds, right out of the factory. Not bad at all. Recommended Stories
